description: French Prime Minister François Bayrou will request the vote in a special session ahead of the autumn budget process. The left-wing La France Insoumise and far-right Rassemblement National parties said they would vote against his minority government.

description: Those who died in the strike on Nasser Hospital include a freelancer for the Associated Press, an Al Jazeera journalist and two contractors for Reuters.

headline: Italy's Salvini renews attacks on Macron
description: Two days after the French Foreign Ministry summoned Italy's ambassador, the Italian deputy prime minister doubled down on his criticism of the French president, portraying him as a warmonger over the Ukrainian issue.

headline: French Riviera town unveils monument equating Nazism and Communism, fueling protests
description: Saint-Raphaël's right-wing mayor, no stranger to media stunts, has vowed to 'put an end to the lies about the reality of communist totalitarianism.' In response, the French Communist Party and other left-wing groups denounced the 'revisionism of history.'

headline: UK's far right mobilizes around asylum crisis: 'I don't want to pay for them anymore'
description: Following a court decision upholding the closure of a hotel housing migrants in Epping Forest, opposition to their presence has shown no sign of waning, as seen on Saturday, August 23, in Horley, southern England.

headline: From Brittany to the Alps, French cities restrict holiday homes
description: Faced with the challenge of housing the residents of highly touristic or attractive cities, some mayors have decided to ban the construction of new vacation properties.

headline: François Truffaut's obsession with Isabelle Adjani
description: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (2/6). While making a name for herself at the Comédie Française, the young actress became the French filmmaker's obsession, who courted her insistently on the set of 'The Story of Adèle H.' in 1975. She resisted him and made her mark with a performance full of restrained violence.
